meanings.definition: Able to be recognized as different or distinct.
meanings.sent1: The two cats had distinguishable fur colors.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's voice was distinguishable in the noisy classroom.
meanings.sent3: It was easy to spot the distinguishable clown at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her distinguishable laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The distinguishable smell of fresh cookies wafted through the house.

meanings.definition: Capable of being distinguished or perceived as separate.
meanings.sent1: The twins had distinguishable birthmarks on their arms.
meanings.sent2: The different bird songs were distinguishable in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The distinguishable flavors of the ice cream made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His distinguishable talent for painting amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The distinguishable sound of the train whistle echoed in the valley.
